Perceptor:

"I seee"hissed Perceptor"Follow me... "

Perceptor walked towards quarter's area





--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "raccoon7679" <raccoon7679@y...> 
wrote:
> Battera::
> 
> She looked up at Perceptor. "Yes. I have completely lost my way. I 
> have found every other nook and cranny here, but where I need to 
be. 
> That computer over there, I know it's a med console, but I was 
hoping 
> it could at least give me directions. No, it just spouts medical 
> terms at me."  She smiled at him in a warm and innocent 
manner. "So 
> where pray tell are the sleeping quarters? And will you please 
show 
> me? I do not wish to get lost again."
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > Perpector:
> > 
> > 
> > Perceptor looked at Battera left the medic lab and said "AHHHHH, 
> > Battera, it's nice to see you here... what do you need? are you 
> lost?"
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "raccoon7679" <raccoon7679@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > Battera::
> > > 
> > > She went walking down the halls around the base.  She located 
the 
> > > engineering section, the prisoner holding cells, the main 
> > ventilation 
> > > supply systems, lab and hanger bays.  She was just wondering 
> > around, 
> > > looking rather lost and not sure of where to go.  She 
eventually 
> > > found the Med bays and went to the console.  She looked around 
> > first 
> > > to make sure that no one was looking. Then, she opened up the 
> > console 
> > > pad and started to look for info on the bot Nightlight.
> > > 
> > > She soon found what she was looking for. THe original bot 
known 
> as 
> > > nightlight had been here. Was reprogrammed and into another 
bot. 
> > She 
> > > was about to find the name when she heard a noise. She closed 
out 
> > the 
> > > computer terminal and made a rather loud sigh. "Drat. I try to 
> find 
> > > the map to find my way around and this stupid computer won't 
help 
> > me. 
> > > All it does is bring up medical stuff to which I know nothing 
> > about. 
> > > By the PIT won't this bad day just end already."  She whined a 
> > little 
> > > and turned to leave. Her head low and her shoulders drooping a 
> bit, 
> > > just incase someone was watching.
